evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

ICAO Annex (Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation) Attachment C lists typical examples of incidents that are likely to be classified as serious. This list includes: ‘Take-off or landing incidents. Incidents such as under-shooting, overrunning or running off the side of runways.’ The operator did not instigate an internal safety review for this serious incident.
Personnel The commander did not supply the investigation with details of their flight licence, medical status, flying experience or recency.

Meteorology The reports submitted to the AAIB did not contain meteorological information, but the UK Met Office generated a limited aftercast for the time of the serious incident. The report found that: ● The weather conditions on the day were characterised by light east to north easterly winds with scattered cloud.
● The TUPJ TAF included a risk of thunderstorms from 1800 hrs UTC, with an associated forecast reduction in visibility and cloud bases.

● The reported intensity of the rainfall at the airfield along with the number of lightning strikes recorded on the weather radar imagery at indicated an active CB cell was over or close to the territory at the time of the serious incident.
● There was no indication of any significant wind shear in association with the thunderstorms, but the Met Office did not have access to the full record of wind speed or direction.

Weather radar image at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November 2024 (crosses indicate lightning strikes) Aircraft examination The flight crew did not notice any aircraft damage on the turnaround at TUPJ. During maintenance action after the return flight ‘marks of contact’ were found on the left mainwheel tyre which required it to be removed and replaced. The operator did not identify any other airframe damage.
The runway chart for TUPJ alerts pilots to occasional windshear on the approach to Rwy 07 when the winds are from the south and south-east.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

children_spec.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs, communication device logs, and physical presence records to confirm availability

children_spec.statement: Communication devices used by the crew were operational and accessible
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect maintenance records and device functionality tests to verify device availability and accessibility

children_spec.statement: Crew members were not engaged in conflicting tasks that prevented communication
children_spec.test_procedure: Review task assignments and timing to determine if crew were free to communicate when needed

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components required for control are physically present and intact
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect the aircraft's mechanical control components for presence and physical integrity; absence or damage would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components are free from obstructions or blockages
children_spec.test_procedure: Check for any foreign objects, debris, or mechanical blockages in control linkages; detection of obstructions would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components are properly connected and secured
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify mechanical linkages and fasteners are correctly connected and tightened; loose or disconnected parts would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical control components operate smoothly without excessive friction or binding
children_spec.test_procedure: Perform functional tests to assess smoothness of mechanical control movement; detection of binding or excessive friction would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical flight information in a timely manner
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and flight data to identify delays or omissions in information exchange

children_spec.statement: Crew did not follow established communication protocols during the flight
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare recorded communications against standard operating procedures and checklists

children_spec.statement: Crew coordination was impaired by misunderstandings or misinterpretations of instructions
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze transcripts and interviews for evidence of confusion or incorrect interpretation of commands

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental data (e.g., weather, lighting) was available at the time of the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Check if environmental data records exist and are accessible for the event timeframe

children_spec.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, signals) was available and documented for the location and time of the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify presence of marking documentation or records relevant to the event location and time

children_spec.statement: The available environmental and marking data were accessible to the relevant personnel during the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Determine if personnel had access to the environmental and marking data at the time of the event

children_spec.statement: The environmental conditions at the time of the incident match the key features associated with the deficiency
children_spec.test_procedure: Compare recorded environmental data (weather, visibility, lighting) with the key features defining the deficiency to confirm alignment

children_spec.statement: The physical markings or signage present at the location correspond to the key features of the marking deficiency
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect and document the markings or signage at the site and compare them against the defined key features of the marking deficiency

children_spec.statement: The environmental or marking deficiencies identified are consistent with prior similar incidents or known patterns
children_spec.test_procedure: Review historical incident reports and data to verify if the deficiencies align with established patterns or precedents

children_spec.statement: Availability of required pushback equipment at the time of operation
children_spec.test_procedure: Check maintenance and operational logs for equipment readiness and downtime records

children_spec.statement: Availability of trained personnel to perform pushback according to procedure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review staffing rosters and training records for personnel assigned to pushback duties

children_spec.statement: Availability of clear communication channels between pushback crew and flight deck
children_spec.test_procedure: Evaluate communication logs and equipment functionality during pushback operations

children_spec.statement: Pushback procedure deviated from standard communication protocols
children_spec.test_procedure: Review recorded communications and transcripts for deviations from prescribed pushback communication steps

children_spec.statement: Pushback vehicle operation did not follow prescribed movement and positioning steps
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze pushback vehicle movement logs and video footage to verify adherence to standard positioning and movement procedures

children_spec.statement: Crew failed to perform required safety checks before or during pushback
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine checklist completion records and crew statements to confirm if all safety checks were performed as required

children_spec.statement: Environmental conditions did not degrade the visibility or legibility of markings
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess weather, lighting, and environmental factors at the time to determine if markings were obscured or faded

children_spec.statement: Markings were applied according to regulatory standards and specifications
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance and inspection records to verify compliance with marking standards

children_spec.statement: Markings remained physically intact and undamaged at the time of the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Conduct physical inspection or photographic evidence review to confirm absence of damage or wear

node.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, signals) was available and documented for the location and time of the event

assumptions: Frangible light is considered marking information (signage, signals) relevant to the event location and time
defeaters: If evidence showed the marking was missing or not documented at the time of the event
If the frangible light was not considered part of marking information

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) confirms the presence and documentation of marking information (frangible light) at the location and time of the event, supporting the claim that marking information was available and documented.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit statement confirming signage or signals beyond the frangible light; possible ambiguity about completeness of marking information

children_spec.statement: The mechanical components show signs of wear or damage consistent with failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect mechanical parts for wear, cracks, or deformation; evidence of intact components would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Control system logs or data indicate malfunction or abnormal operation prior to the event
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze control system logs and sensor data for anomalies; absence of anomalies would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Maintenance records reveal unresolved mechanical or control issues relevant to the failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review maintenance and repair logs for outstanding issues; clean maintenance history would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Mechanical components show no signs of wear or damage that would cause failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Inspect mechanical components for wear, cracks, or deformation; evidence of damage would lower confidence

children_spec.statement: Control system inputs and outputs function within specified parameters without anomalies
children_spec.test_procedure: Test control system signals and responses; detection of abnormal signals or failures would lower confidence

children_spec.statement: No external factors such as environmental conditions or human interference caused mechanical or control failure
children_spec.test_procedure: Review environmental data and human activity logs; evidence of external interference would lower confidence

node.statement: Mechanical components required for control are physically present and intact

defeaters: Direct inspection or maintenance records confirming the physical presence and intactness of mechanical control components
Evidence of mechanical control component damage or absence

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew did not notice any aircraft damage on the turnaround at TUPJ. During maintenance action after the return flight marks of contact were found on the left mainwheel tyre which required it to be removed and replaced. The operator did not identify any other airframe damage.
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: No direct evidence states that mechanical components required for control were physically present and intact. The flight crew did not notice aircraft damage (H11), and the commander was unaware of striking the light (S3), suggesting no obvious mechanical control damage, but this is indirect and does not confirm presence or intactness of mechanical control components.

children_spec.statement: Crew members failed to share critical information in a timely manner
children_spec.test_procedure: Review cockpit voice recordings and communication logs to identify delays or omissions in information sharing

children_spec.statement: Crew did not effectively coordinate tasks during the flight
children_spec.test_procedure: Analyze flight data and crew actions to determine if task coordination was inadequate or inconsistent

children_spec.statement: Crew failed to resolve misunderstandings or conflicts promptly
children_spec.test_procedure: Examine cockpit voice recordings for evidence of unresolved disagreements or confusion among crew members

node.statement: Crew members were physically present and reachable during the operation

assumptions: Responding to airfield authorities' enquiries implies physical presence and reachability during or immediately after the operation
defeaters: Evidence that crew members were absent or unreachable during the operation
Reports indicating failure to respond to communications or inquiries
Contradictory statements about crew presence or availability

quotes.exact_quote: Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’
While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The flight crew were physically present and reachable during the operation as evidenced by their communication with airfield authorities (H3, H4, S3). The commander provided a statement and responded to enquiries, indicating availability and reachability despite being unaware of the damage caused.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit statements about crew physical presence at the exact time of the operation; assumption based on their later communication and response.

children_spec.statement: The procedural deviation is resistant to correction by standard operating procedures
children_spec.test_procedure: Evaluate if adherence to standard operating procedures eliminates the deviation; if it does, this child is falsified

children_spec.statement: The procedural deviation persists despite crew training and awareness
children_spec.test_procedure: Assess if enhanced crew training and awareness reduce or eliminate the deviation; if yes, this child is falsified

children_spec.statement: The procedural deviation is not mitigated by existing safety checks and monitoring systems
children_spec.test_procedure: Check if safety checks and monitoring systems detect and prevent the deviation; if they do, this child is falsified

node.statement: Availability of clear communication channels between pushback crew and flight deck

defeaters: If evidence describing communication protocols or equipment between pushback crew and flight deck were found.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items mentions or describes the availability of clear communication channels between pushback crew and flight deck.
